data.title: PatrickChristopherPatSullivan
data.text:
Patrick Christopher âPatâ Sullivan

LOWELLÂ Â Â Â Patrick Christopher âPatâ Sullivan, 29, of Lowell, passed away at home after an accident, on Monday, April 3, 2017. Â He was the beloved husband of Jennifer (Muldoon) Sullivan with whom he celebrated their First Wedding Anniversary this past January.

Â Â Â A son of Kevin and Kelly (Gill) Sullivan of Lowell, he was born August 30, 1987 in Lowell, and was educated in the local schools, graduating from Lowell High School where he was on the wrestling team.Â He then attended Middlesex Community College.

Â Â Â Patrick enjoyed cooking, hiking, four wheeling, ATV riding, his motorcycle, and snow boarding, and had recently returned from a snow boarding trip last month.Â His favorite past time was spending time at home with his wife.

Â Â Â Besides his beloved wife, Jennifer, and his loving parents, Kevin and Kelly Sullivan, he is survived by his brothers, Kevin Sullivan, Christopher Sullivan, and Daniel Sullivan, all of Lowell; his mother and father in law, Ruth and Michael Webber of Lowell; his sister in law, Nicole McNeal and her husband Devin of Orange; his brothers in law, Michael Webber and Matthew Webber both of Lowell; his maternal grandparents, Daniel and Madeline Gill of Tewksbury; his paternal grandmother, Noella Sullivan of Pelham, NH; his nephew, Cole McNeal of Orange; his God Daughter, Shayla Rourke of Lowell; his aunts and uncles , Daniel Gill, who was also his Godfather and his wife, Jessica, of Groton, Sean Sullivan and his wife, Cheryl, of Hudson, NH, Shane Sullivan and his wife, Crystal, of Dracut, Noella Ann Rourke and her husband, Ryan of Lowell; and his grandmother in law, Jeanne Muldoon of Lowell.Â In addition, Patrick is survived by many close friends, including his lifelong friends, Andy, Jay, and Joe.

Â Â Â

He was also a grandson of the late Patrick Sullivan.

Â Â Â Â YOU ARE INVITED TO HIS CALLING HOURS 12 NOON UNTIL 4 P.M. ON SUNDAY, APRIL 9. Â

ON MONDAY, HIS FUNERAL WILL BEGIN AT 9 A.M. AT THE MCDONOUGH FUNERAL HOME, 14 HIGHLAND STREET, LOWELL 978-458-6816.Â HIS FUNERAL MASS WILL BE OFFERED AT ST. MARGARET CHURCH, 374 STEVENS ST., LOWELL AT 10 A.M..Â BURIAL IN ST. PATRICK CEMETERY. Â
